Pre-Game Insights: Dalton Knecht earned his first NBA and LA Lakers start on Wednesday against the Memphis Grizzlies due to the absence of Rui Hachimura and Anthony Davis, who combined to average 43 points per game.
The Lakers were thin on the frontcourt, offering Knecht a spot in the starting lineup, despite his lack of rhythm early on.
Knecht attempted two 3-pointers but missed both, finishing the first quarter with three points after making a 3 on his third attempt.
He played only five minutes in the second quarter, attempting one more 3-pointer but missing it, adding a rebound but otherwise struggling defensively and offensively.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Lakers were down 4-4 on the season, including 1-4 on their five-game road trip, returning home Friday to host the 76ers.
LeBron James scored 39 points on 62.5% shooting, waging a lone war for the team.
